p: The significant reduction ( P < 0.05) in plasma “corrected” calcium ion level at AESG 1000 mg/kg suggests that AESG might have repressed parathyroid functioning at that dose [ 73]. Moreso, poor proximal and distal tubule reabsorption of calcium, elicited by AESG, might have also resulted in hypoparathyroidism. The significant reduction ( P < 0.05) in plasma bicarbonate ion level at AESG 500 and 2000 mg/kg suggests AESG-induced compensatory response to metabolic alkalosis [ 74] ( Figs. 18–21 ).
